page.title: 06Almshouse Charity of Clun
page.content: Trinity hospital's full name is the Hospital of the Holy and Undivided Trinity in Clun. There is a court yard with ten separate cottages for the residents. Another courtyard adjoins with a warden's house,the chapel,a housekeeper's house and a gardener's cottage. There are 6 residents plus an assistant keeper plus a gentleman who lives in the warden's house making 8 people. The hospital has some small investments which bring about 2000 pounds a year. There are grants from Grenwich Hospital which was built about the same time as Holy Trinity in Clun amounting to Â£1500. There are rents from various fields which bring about 200 pounds a year.The house rents bring about 7000 pounds. It was designed in the first place to make a home for poor old men to live.
